Note.Content: There are no doubt certain subtle distinctions in the meanings of the terms in {D:83.9}. For example, πρός[d] may suggest some kind of interaction or response and παρά[b] may focus upon association, but it is difficult, if not impossible, on the basis of existing contexts to define precisely the differences in meaning.

In the meaning of extension toward a goal, εἰς[a] ({D:84.16}) and ἐπί[e] ({D:84.17}) overlap considerably. It is, of course, possible to argue that ἐπί implies being on or at a point, while εἰς defines entering into an area related to some point, but such a distinction would seem to be arbitrary.

The difference in meaning between the set κατά[g], ἐπί[s], ἐν[s], ἐκ[k], and καθώς[d] and the set πότε, ποτέ[b], ὁπότε, ὅτε[a], and ὅταν[b] ({D:67.30}) is largely a matter of class meanings, but there may be certain subtle rhetorical differences as well.
Since the concept of authority expresses only the manner in which the interpretation of the Law takes place, one may be justified in classifying this idiom under Domain 33 Communication.
It is very possible that the two idioms in {D:28.64} differ somewhat in meaning, or at least in connotation, but it is difficult, if not impossible, to show this from existing contexts.

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: On, Upon, On the Surface Of

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: a position on a surface of an object, whether vertical or horizontal, and in contact with the object
a position in proximity to or in the immediate vicinity of an object or other position
a position within an area determined by other objects and distributed among such objects{N:001}

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: In Front Of, Face To Face, In Back Of, Behind

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: a position before, with the implication of a relationship of authority
extension toward a goal, usually implying reaching the goal{N:002}
extension to a goal, with implied contact on a horizontal surface
(with the accusative) a marker of the one upon whom responsibility falls
a marker of the experiencer, often with the implication of an action by a superior force or agency
(with the dative) a marker of instrument as the basis for some event
(with the accusative or dative) a marker of opposition in a judicial or quasijudicial context
(with the dative) a marker of persons benefited by an event, with the implication of their being in a dependent relationship
a marker of an addition to what already exists, but with the possible implication of something more significant
a marker of the object over which someone exercises a control or authority
a marker of cause or reason as the basis for a subsequent event or state
a marker of purpose, pointing to the goal of an event or state
(with the genitive) a marker of content as a means of specifying a particular referent
a marker of the basis of some event

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Up To, As Much As, To the Degree That [Marked Extent of Degree]

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: a degree extending to a particular point as marked by the context

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: A Point of Time with Reference to Other Points of Time: Before, Long Ago, Now, At the Same Time, When, About, After

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: a marker of a point of time which is simultaneous to or overlaps with another point of time{N:003}

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Duration of Time with Reference to Some Unit of Time: During, In, While, Throughout

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: a marker of the extent of time within a unit

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Agent, Personal or Nonpersonal, Causative or Immediate, Direct or Indirect

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: (with the accusative) a marker of agent, with the added implication of effect upon the agent
LEXSense.Comments: It is possible that in {S:05300101000038} there is a double relation marked by ἐπί, for it may be construed as marking the affected participant with τὸ μαρτύριον and at the same time the agent participant with ἐπιστεύθη. It is this double role which may account for the use of ἐπί rather than ὑπό, which would clearly mark a relation with ἐπιστεύθη, or πρός, which would indicate clearly a relation with μαρτύριον.

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: A Point of Time with Reference to Other Points of Time: Before, Long Ago, Now, At the Same Time, When, About, After

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: (an idiom, literally: at the doors) a point of time subsequent to another point of time and indicating imminence, that is to say, the subsequent event is regarded as almost begun

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Duration of Time without Reference to Points or Units of Time: Time, Spend Time, Always, Eternal, Old, Immediately, Young

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: pertaining to a relatively long duration of time

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Assign to a Role or Function

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: (an idiom, literally: upon someone’s head) to accept responsibility for some action, often with the implication of blame
LEXSense.Comments: This statement in {S:04401800600030} is no doubt an adage meaning that anything bad which may happen to a person, including one’s death, will be one’s own responsibility, and therefore no one else is to blame.|It is also possible to classify this idiom in Domain 90D. Note that in {D:37.102} the focus is on the assignment of responsibility.

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: (an idiom, literally: to sit upon the seat of Moses) to have the capacity to interpret the Law of Moses with authority{N:004}

Glosses.Gloss: to be an authority concerning the Law of Moses

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: (an idiom, literally: on the housetops) pertaining to being widely known in view of the events in question having taken place in public{N:005}

LEXSubDomains.LEXSubDomain: Duration of Time without Reference to Points or Units of Time: Time, Spend Time, Always, Eternal, Old, Immediately, Young

LEXSense.DefinitionShort: (an idiom, literally: upon enough) duration of time for a considerable period, with the focus upon sufficiency of time

Glosses.Gloss: during a considerable period of time
